results.title: Treating hypertension in women of child-bearing age and during pregnancy.
results.text_hl: There is no consensus as to whether mild-to-moderate @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ in pregnancy should be treated: the risks of transient severe @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, antenatal hospitalisation, @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ at delivery and @<m>DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome_Newborn</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012127 @@@neonatal respiratory distress syndrome@@@ may be decreased by therapy, but intrauterine fetal growth may also be impaired, particularly by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Magee LA. Treating hypertension in women of child-bearing age and during pregnancy. Drug Saf. 2001;24(6):457-74. PMID: 11368252
